title: International External Advisory Visit to Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS (UTP)
about: Gunasekaran Raja from NGNLab is serving as an International External Advisor for Universiti Teknologi PETRONAS (UTP), Malaysia, from April 2023 to June 2027. As part of this role, he visited UTP in October 2023 and November 2025 to evaluate the Bachelor of Computer Engineering (Hons) programme. Working alongside 12 international experts, he reviewed the curriculum, teaching–learning delivery, industrial internship structure, assessment standards, facilities, and academic resources in line with global trends. He also interacted with students, faculty members, management, alumni, and industry partners to gather comprehensive insights. His findings and recommendations were presented to the academic committee.

title: Visit to Universiti Malaya, Malaysia
about: Gunasekaran Raja from NGNLab visited Universiti Malaya (UM), Malaysia, in November 2025. During the visit, he interacted with Dr. LING Teck Chaw from the Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology, focusing on Software-Defined Solutions for 6G networks. The discussions enabled meaningful collaboration with UM researchers, fostering the exchange of knowledge and expertise between the two institutions. This visit also broadened research horizons and identified new areas of mutual interest, strengthening academic and research ties between Anna University and Universiti Malaya.

title: Mr. Karthikeyan Arunachalam from TII, Abu Dhabi, visits NGNLab
about: As part of ongoing collaborative efforts, NGNLab and the Department of Computer Technology at Anna University hosted Mr. Karthikeyan Arunachalam, Lead Researcher at the Secure Systems Research Centre (SSRC) of the Technology Innovation Institute (TII), Abu Dhabi, on August 9, 2025. The visit focused on strengthening partnerships in cutting-edge research areas, including next-generation secure communications, zero-trust security, autonomous systems, AI-driven security, and emerging transport network technologies, while also exploring potential funding avenues.The discussions underscored opportunities for joint projects, technology co-development, and impactful research collaborations, further strengthening the academia–industry interface.

title: NGNs Participate in Department of Telecommunications TTDF Symposium 2025 at IIT Madras Research Park
about: As part of the 6G project, NGNs participated and presented their project progress at the Department of Telecommunications TTDF Symposium 2025, held from 19th to 21st June 2025 at the IIT Madras Research Park. Project teams from across the country took part in the symposium and showcased their ongoing work. The event was highly interactive and provided valuable insights and ideas to further enhance our project.

title: NGN Visits Munster Technological University, Ireland under Erasmus Mobility Programme
about: Gunasekaran Raja from NGNLab visited Munster Technological University (MTU), Ireland, in June 2025 under the Erasmus+ International Credit Mobility Programme. The visit facilitated meaningful collaboration with MTU researchers, enabling the exchange of knowledge and expertise across institutions. The programme also helped broaden research horizons and explore new areas of mutual interest between Anna University and MTU, fostering stronger academic and research ties.

title: NGNLab Team Ranks Among Top 105 Globally in Google Solution Challenge 2025
about: NGNs Mugundh J B, Selva Ragul Kumar, Pronoy Kundu, and Hirthik Raj A from NGNLab secured a spot among the Top 105 teams worldwide in the Google Solution Challenge 2025. Their project, ResQLink: Autonomous UAV-Assisted Disaster Relief System, addresses the UN SDG challenge on disaster management. Selected from over 64,000 registrations and 3,700+ submissions, the recognition reflects their innovation and commitment to real-world impact.

title: Dr. Madhan Raj Kanagarathinam from Samsung R&D Institute Visits NGNLab
about:
As part of ongoing collaborative efforts, NGNLab and the Department of Computer Technology at Anna University hosted Dr. Madhan Raj Kanagarathinam, Architect, Connectivity R&D, from Samsung R&D Institute India – Bangalore (SRI-B) on 16th May 2025. The visit focused on strengthening partnerships in cutting-edge research areas such as next-generation connectivity, emerging network technologies, and exploring potential funding avenues.
The discussions aimed to align academic research strengths with industrial innovation, fostering opportunities for joint projects, technology co-development, and impactful research initiatives. This engagement marks a step forward in enhancing the academia-industry interface for mutual growth and innovation.

title: Anna University Alumnus Visit: Dr. Sathishkumar V E,  Sunway University, Malaysia
about:
On April 2025, NGNLab proudly welcomed esteemed alumnus, Dr. Sathishkumar V E, an Assistant Professor at Sunway University, Malaysia.
Dr. Sathishkumar V E is currently leading the Database and Data Mining Lab at Sunway University. His research focuses on predictive analytics, machine learning, and intelligent systems. He is particularly involved in real-time data modeling for applications in smart cities, healthcare, and sustainable technologies.
During his visit, Dr. Sathish engaged with NGNLab students, sharing valuable insights and encouraging them to pursue advanced research in 5G and 6G AI and analytics efforts.

title: NGNLab invites applications for Summer Internship 2025
about:
Explore cutting-edge research in 5G/6G, Quantum Security, UAVs, Autonomous Vehicles, and Medical IoT at NGNLab, MIT Campus, Anna University. Selected students will work on real-world problems alongside expert faculty and global collaborators during a 6-week summer internship.
Last date to submit application: May 09, 2025.

title: NGNs Secure Department of Telecommunications Internship for  6G Research
about: NGNs Rajalakshmi S, Sanjeev A, Krithika R, Sachin K S, and Hirthik Raj A have secured a Research Internship as part of the 6G research project funded by the Department of Telecommunications, Government of India. They will engage in cutting-edge research in 5G, beyond 5G, and 6G technologies, with a focus on establishing end-to-end connectivity at the 6G Ubiquitous Connectivity Lab, Department of Computer Technology, Anna University.

title: NGNs Secure Government of India Internship for Quantum 6G Research
about: NGNs Ms. Shivani Suresh and Ms. Priyadharshini V, have secured a six-month Work-Based Learning Research Internship from the Government of India. They will conduct research on Quantum Technologies for 6G Networks at the Education and Research Network (ERNET), IITM Research Park, Chennai, India.

title: Joint Collaboration with Technology Innovation Institute (TII)
about: NGNLab has established a collaboration with the Technology Innovation Institute (TII), UAE, to conduct joint research on Secure Systems, focusing on Autonomous Vehicles, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles, and 5G/6G networks.

title: DoT Research Grants for NGNLab to Establish '6G Ubiquitous Connectivity Lab and Cutting-Edge Research'
about: The Department of Telecommunications, India, has sanctioned a three-year research grant for NGNLab to establish the '6G Ubiquitous Connectivity Lab: Advancing India's Health and Agriculture through Innovative Technologies.'

title: Joint Collaboration with Samsung R&D Institute India-Bangalore (SRI-B)
about: NGNLab has partnered with Samsung R&D Institute India-Bangalore (SRI-B) to carry out joint research in 5G/6G networks and Autonomous Systems, emphasizing AI/ML technologies and transport layer protocols.

title: NGNLab paper was presented at the EAI BODYNETS 2024 conference at IIT BHU, Varanasi
about: The paper 'AI/ML-driven Early Detection of Chemotherapy-induced Renal Vascular Tissue Damage.' co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Selvam Essaky, Kalimuthu Karuppanan, Sudhakar Theerthagiri, Bharathkumaran Mohanraj, Gopi Agasthia Senniappan, Logeswari Sureshkumar was presented at the 2024 EAI BODYNETS 19th EAI International Conference on Body Area Networks, December 15-16, 2024, in IIT BHU, Varanasi, India.

title: NGNLab paper was presented at the IEEE ICDM 2024 conference in Abu Dhabi
about: The paper 'CardioNetFusion: A Deep Learning and Explainable AI Integrated System for Cardiovascular Disease Detection.' co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Selvam Essaky, Surya Raj Muthu, Babith Sarish Suresh, Jaehyuk Cho, Seohyun Yoo, Sathishkumar, was presented at the 2024 IEEE ICDM International Conference on Data Mining, December 09-12, 2024, in Abu Dhabi, UAE.

title: NGNLab Alumnus Visit: Dr. Sheeba Backia Mary, Lead Security Architect at Lenovo, Germany
about:
On October 21, 2024, NGNLab proudly welcomed its esteemed alumnus, Dr. Sheeba Backia Mary, who serves as the Lead Security Architect at Lenovo, Germany.

Dr. Sheeba plays a pivotal role in Lenovo’s global telecommunications standardization efforts, with a focus on next-generation networks and security development. She represents both Lenovo and Motorola Mobility in key international bodies, including the 3GPP Security Architecture Working Group (SA WG3) and the ETSI Permissioned Distributed Ledger Working Group (ETSI PDL). During her visit, Dr. Sheeba engaged with NGNLab students, sharing valuable insights and encouraging them to pursue advanced research in 5G and 6G security and standardization efforts.

title: NGNLab paper, in collaboration with Samsung R&D India, has been selected for presentation at the IEEE GLOBECOM 2024 conference in Cape Town, South Africa.
about: The paper  'OBSDNN: Optimal Beam Selection employing Deep Neural Networks in 6G Environment',  co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Madhan Raj Kanagarahinam, Deepak Suresh Rajendran, Sree Vinay Ravuru and Sidhaarthan Mamalaivasan has been selected for presentation in the 2024 IEEE GLOBECOM Global Communications Conference Workshop,  December 8-12, 2024, in Cape Town, South Africa.

title: NGNLab paper was presented at the IEEE FNWF 2024 conference in Dubai
about: The paper 'Advanced Cognitive System for Reliable Lane Switch Prediction in Autonomous Vehicles.' co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Shivani Suresh, Jeyadev Needhidevan, and Shajina Anand, was presented at the 2024 IEEE FNWF Future Networks World Forum,  October 15-17, 2024, in Dubai, UAE.

title: NGNLab invites paper submissions to the workshop at the IEEE ICDM 2024 conference.
about:
Paper submissions are invited to the workshop on 'Advances in AI-Driven Data Mining for Autonomous Systems workshop (AIDM-AS 2024)' in conjunction with the '2024 IEEE International Conference on Data Mining (ICDM 2024)' which is to be held in Abu Dhabi, UAE, from December 9-12, 2024.
Last date to submit papers: September 10, 2024.

title: NGNLab invites paper submissions to the IEEE FNWF 2024 conference
about:
Paper submissions are invited to the IEEE FNWF 2024 conference. Paper submissions are invited to Track 4: 5G and Future Network Special Verticals at the IEEE Future Networks World Forum, held in Dubai, UAE, from October 15-17, 2024.
Last date to submit papers: July 31, 2024.

title: NGNLab papers were presented at the IEEE VTC 2024-Spring conference in Singapore
about: Papers "PointGAN: A Catalyst for Enhanced Vulnerable Road User Detection in Autonomous Navigation" co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Hosam Alhakami, Sahaya Beni Prathiba, Jeyadev Needhidevan, Priyadarshni Vasudevan, Rupali Subramanian, Kapal Dev and "Next-Gen Security: Enhanced DDoS Attack Detection for Autonomous Vehicles in 6G Networks" co-authored by Sudha Anbalagan, Wajdi Alhakami, Mugundh Jambukeswaran Bhooma, Vijai Suria Marimuthu, Kapal Dev, Gunasekaran Raja were presented in IEEE: VTC 2024-Spring 99th Vehicular Technology Conference, June 24-27, 2024, in Singapore.

title: NGNLab paper was presented at the IEEE ICC 2024 conference in Denver, USA
about: Paper 'Adaptive Model Predictive Control-Driven Approach for Visual Detection of Micro-UAVs' co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Selvam Essaky, Deepak Suresh Rajendran, Sai Ganesh Senthivel, Sebastian Knorr, Kapal Dev, was presented in 2024 IEEE ICC International Conference on Communications, June 9-13, 2024, in Denver, USA.

title: NGNLab Alumnus Vishal Ravichandran Admitted into a Master's Program at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
about: Vishal Ravichandran, a current alumnus of NGNLab, was accepted into the Masters in Computer Science program at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign for the Fall 2024 term.  Illinois is consistently ranked among the top 5 universities in the United States for computer science-related programs, making this a significant accomplishment for Vishal.

title: Ph.D Scholar from Ernst-Abbe-Hochschule, Jena, Germany embarks on Research Internship at Anna University, Chennai
about: Herbert Potechius, a Ph.D. student from the University of Applied Sciences Jena in Germany, undertakes a research internship at Anna University, Chennai in March 2024, facilitated by the DST-DAAD's 'Project-Related Personal Exchange (PPP)' funding program. During his time at Anna University, Herbert will engage in research activities at the NGNLab, focusing on immersive imaging, virtual reality, and UAV communications.

title: NGNLab and Department of Computer Technology Present: Two-Day Transnational Workshop on 'Smart Technologies for Societal Health'
about: On March 4th and 5th, 2024, the two-day Transnational Workshop on Smart Technologies for Societal Health convened experts from the UK, India, Malaysia, Vietnam, and Oman. Centered on AI, computer vision, robotics, and autonomous systems, it aimed to improve Societal Health in disaster-stricken regions. Featuring keynote lectures, panel discussions, and breakout sessions, participants addressed technical challenges and forged collaborative research plans.

title: NGNLab paper is accepted for presentation at the IEEE INFOCOM 2024 International Conference in Vancouver, Canada
about: Paper "CPP-OTPO: A Cognitive Multi-UAV System for Adaptive Path and Trajectory Optimization" co-authored by Gunasekaran Raja, Selvam Essaky, Surya Raj M, Jawaharlal Nehru N, Christ Joe, Kapal Dev, Waleed Ejaz, is to be presented in IEEE INFOCOM 2024 International Conference on Computer Communications-Workshop, 20-23 May 2024, in Vancouver, Canada.

title: Project Associate Position in NGNLab under SERB project grant
about:
Under the SERB, DST-Government of India project grant, applications are invited for a Project Associate position in the NGNLab, Dept. of Computer Technology, Anna University, Chennai.
Last Date of Application: 15.01.2024.

title: NGNLab papers were presented at the IEEE GLOBECOM 2023 conference in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
about: Papers "AI-empowered UAV Trajectory Optimization in 6G Aerial Networks" and  "TVUB: Thermal Vision-based UAV and Blockchain-aided Poaching Prevention System," co-authored by  Sai Ganesh, Sivaganesh B, Vishal Ravichandran, Saroja S, and Abhishek Manoharan, were presented in IEEE GLOBECOM 2023 conference, December 4-8, 2023, in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

title: NGNLab Principal Investigator recognized as one of the World’s Top 2% Scientists for 2022
about: NGNLab Principal Investigator is recognized as one of the World’s Top 2% Scientists for 2022 by Stanford University, USA, in the field of Information and Communication Technology.

title: NGNLab, Ph.D. student attends Research Internship at Ernst-Abbe-Hochschule Jena, Germany
about: Selvam Essaky, a Ph.D. student from NGNLab, attends a research internship at Ernst-Abbe-Hochshule Jena, Germany (September 2023 to October 2023) under the DAAD program. The program allowed him to collaborate with researchers from Ernst-Abbe-Hochshule Jena, Germany, share knowledge, and leverage each other's expertise.  This program allowed Selvam to broaden his research horizons and investigate new areas of interest.

title: NGNLab Alumnus Sai Ganesh Senthivel Admitted into a Master's Program at CMU
about: Sai Ganesh Senthivel, a current alumnus of NGNLab, was accepted into the Masters in Information Technology - Information Security program at the esteemed Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) for the Fall 2022 term. CMU is consistently ranked among the top 5 universities in the United States for computer science-related programs, making this a significant accomplishment for Sai.

title: NGNLab Ph.D. Student Attends Exchange Programme at Trinity College Dublin
about: Selvam Essaky, a PhD student from NGNLab,  attended an exchange program at Trinity College Dublin in Ireland (October 2022 to April 2023). The program allowed him to collaborate with researchers from Trinity College Dublin, share knowledge, and leverage each other's expertise. While Selvam was at Trinity College Dublin, he participated in diverse academic pursuits and attended workshops related to his field of study. The exchange program allowed Selvam to broaden his research horizons and investigate new areas of interest.

title: NGNs Admitted into Master's Programs at US Universities
about: Abhishek and Srividya have been accepted into graduate programs at two prestigious universities in the United States for the Fall 2023 term. Abhishek has been accepted into the University of Southern California (USC), while Srividya has been accepted into the University of Maryland, College Park (UMCP). USC and UMCP are renowned for their high-quality education and immense research opportunities. Their acceptance reflects their hard work, dedication, and research potential.

title: NGNs Secure High-Paying Jobs with Top Companies
about: NGNs have secured placements in leading companies with lucrative compensation packages for June 2023. Thilaksurya was hired by Wells Fargo, while Balakumar was recruited by Tekion Corp. During the campus placement season, businesses from different industries, such as IT, manufacturing, and consulting, displayed a strong interest in hiring NGNLab students. The lab attributes the successful placements of its students to its strong academic programs, industry partnerships, and well-established alumni network.

title: NGNs bag First prize at Prayatna 22' National level hackathon
about: Students from NGNLab, have been declared the champions of the Prayatna National level hackathon. The winning team comprising Deepak Suresh, Sree Vinay, and Sidhaarthan VM secured the top position in the event organized by AUSEC-MIT and ACT, Anna University.

title: NGNs Participate in a Six-Month Work-Based Learning Internship at ERNET India
about: Four final-year undergraduates from NGNlab, namely Srividya, Nishanthini, Sakthi, and Jagadeesh, have completed a six-month Work-Based Learning Research Internship at Education and Research Network (ERNET), IITM Research Park in Chennai, India. During the internship (November 2022 to April 2023), the students gained valuable insights into Time Sensitive Networking and its implementation on Linux. They also worked on various individual projects covering domains like Blockchain, Natural Language Processing, and Data Analytics. The internship at ERNET India provided the students with an opportunity to apply their theoretical knowledge in a practical setting, preparing them for a successful career ahead.
